required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Metal Contamination After Minimally Invasive Repair of Pectus Excavatum (MIRPE)
clinical_study.official_title: Examination of Metal Contamination After Minimally Invasive Repair of Pectus Excavatum (MIRPE) and the Clinical Relevance

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether there is a metal wear debris after minimally invasive repair of pectus excavatum and if there's a clinical relevance. Our hypothesis is that the metal bar after minimally invasive repair of pectus excavatum leads to a locally and systemic immune reaction due to elevated metal contamination.

primary_outcome.measure: change of mean chromium values in blood (µg/l)
primary_outcome.description: measurement of: 1) chromium in blood (in µg/l) at the time points: pre implantation 4 weeks after implantation (to see change to baseline) 1 year after implantation (to see change to baseline) 2 years after implantation (to see change to baseline) explantation (usually 3 years after implantation; to see change to baseline) 6-12 months after explantation (to see change to explantation) We will compare the mean metal values at each time point post implantation with the mean metal values pre implantation. Clinical data like body weight etc. won't be relevant for the analysis.

primary_outcome.measure: change of mean chromium values in urine (µg/l)
primary_outcome.description: measurement of: 2) chromium in urine (in µg/l) at the time points: pre implantation 4 weeks after implantation (to see change to baseline) 1 year after implantation (to see change to baseline) 2 years after implantation (to see change to baseline) explantation (usually 3 years after implantation; to see change to baseline) 6-12 months after explantation (to see change to explantation) We will compare the mean metal values at each time point post implantation with the mean metal values pre implantation. Clinical data like body weight etc. won't be relevant for the analysis.

primary_outcome.measure: change of mean chromium values in tissue (µg/g)
primary_outcome.description: measurement of: 3) chromium in tissue (in µg/g) at the time points: implantation explantation (usually 3 years after implantation; to see change to baseline) We will compare the mean metal values at explantation with the mean metal values before implantation. Clinical data like body weight etc. won't be relevant for the analysis.

primary_outcome.measure: change of mean nickel values in blood (µg/l)
primary_outcome.description: measurement of: 4) nickel in blood (in µg/l) at the time points: pre implantation 4 weeks after implantation (to see change to baseline) 1 year after implantation (to see change to baseline) 2 years after implantation (to see change to baseline) explantation (usually 3 years after implantation; to see change to baseline) 6-12 months after explantation (to see change to explantation) We will compare the mean metal values at each time point post implantation with the mean metal values pre implantation. Clinical data like body weight etc. won't be relevant for the analysis.

primary_outcome.measure: change of mean nickel values in urine (µg/l)
primary_outcome.description: measurement of: 5) nickel in urine (in µg/l) at the time points: pre implantation 4 weeks after implantation (to see change to baseline) 1 year after implantation (to see change to baseline) 2 years after implantation (to see change to baseline) explantation (usually 3 years after implantation; to see change to baseline) 6-12 months after explantation (to see change to explantation) We will compare the mean metal values at each time point post implantation with the mean metal values pre implantation. Clinical data like body weight etc. won't be relevant for the analysis.

primary_outcome.measure: change of mean nickel values in tissue (µg/g)
primary_outcome.description: measurement of: 6) nickel in tissue (in µg/g) at the time points: implantation explantation (usually 3 years after implantation; to see change to baseline) We will compare the mean metal values at explantation with the mean metal values before implantation. Clinical data like body weight etc. won't be relevant for the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Observation of clinical reactions in correlation with elevated metal values
secondary_outcome.description: observation (description) of clinical symptoms of a metal allergy like local rash lassitude chest pain tachycardia Nausea pleural effusion for the time the bar is in place (3 years) and the metal values are evaluated. -> Then compare the mean metal values (see above) with the baseline and the other patients (with and/or without problems) No records when the patients don't have any problems.

arm_group.description: first minimally invasive repair of pectus excavatum

intervention.intervention_name: minimally invasive repair of pectus excavatum
intervention.description: substernal insertion of a metal bar
metal fixation of a fracture (Kirschner wire, intramedullary nail)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- MIRPE
Exclusion Criteria:
- none
